ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about the world of banking.
Overview of financial crises and tools to monitor and prevent them.
I now much better understand both current and past economic events that have shaped the financial world, and believe I have a very solid grasp on what influences financial stability.

I learned enormously about the recent economic crises and their causes. Taking a class with Sigga, who is a practitioner of central banking and commercial banking, offered me exclusive insights into how our economy operates
Gained insight on different global financial crises and how they came about.
I learnt a lot about the banking sector and financial stability.
I learned about banking and financial crisis
General overview of crises over at at century with a deep dive into a few specific examples

Knowledge of the banking system, causes of financial crises and possible policy tools to mitigate them, case studies of notable crises in history, and macroprudential policies and how they coordinate with fiscal and monetary policies. We also had the opportunity to look into certain crises more in-depth through the presentation and final paper.
Gave a lot of really good insights into the global banking system and a much better sense of economics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Great professor and very chill formatting style
Weaknesses: Lack of canvas use and clear ideas for how to do assignments
Incredible course. Only improvement would be to be more clear on what to expect for the final exam.
Strengths: structured well so that I knew what to expect out of every session, and all material was extremely relevant.
The course was wonderfully structured. I noticed how I was improving with each class. A weakness could be relative ease of the course with few readings and few assignments.
Great course Sigga is amazing
Its a very high level course. It takes time to get used to it.
This is a great course and I learned a lot

Strength: student presentations allowed us to get in depth knowledge on one topic, but weakness: not much accountability for other topics/readings throughout the course, few check ins of our understanding

Strengths: content and slide decks were organized very clearly. Sigga is a very engaging lecturer and often couples content/terms with her own professional experience. She also did a great job relating the course content to everything that happened during COVID. Sigga's also very responsive to students and gave timely feedback. Weakness: a minor one, but sometimes financial jargon might be a little difficult to understand for people with less knowledge of the banking system, so I would've appreciated a little more explanation of foundational terms. But overall great course!
Very good

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, a great senior seminar with a great professor and low workload.
Absolutely. Professor is awesome. Youll learn so much
Yes, especially for students who are going into any finance related or adjacent fields.
Definitely, the course has changed my understanding of economics.
Yes! Great senior Econ seminar
Yes, if youre interested.
I would. It is a great Econ senior seminar
An interesting course if you want to learn more about banking. Good to be self motivated to do readings

Absolutely! This is a great overview of the banking system and financial crises (even more relevant after the pandemic), and Sigga is a super engaging, responsive instructor who brings in tons of industry knowledge. The workload is very manageable (mostly just a presentation and a final paper), and the readings were manageable and well-selected. You might need a foundational background of financial terms / macro knowledge though.
Yes
